After the wedding festivities, honeymoon, receptions and get togethers, Priyanka Chopra is back to work. The diva has already bagged her fourth Hollywood project with an Oscar-winning director Barry Levinson. In the movie, our desi girl will be seen playing the role of spiritual leader Osho's disciple and closest aide Ma Anand Sheela.
In case you didn’t know it already, Ma Anand Sheela is the former right-hand woman to godman Osho. Her popularity grew further after Netflix’s documentary series titled Wild Wild Country released.
Confirming the news, Priyanka Chopra spilled the beans about the project when she recently appeared on Ellen Degeneres show.
wweek.com
“We’re developing it as the character of Sheela, who was this guru who originated from India, his right-hand woman. And she was just devious and created a whole cult in America, brought people here,” she said.
